titleStmt.title: The Furniture of a womans mind.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: A Sett of Phrases learnt by rote,
A Passion for a Scarlet Coat,
When at a Play, to Laugh or Cry,
Yet cannot tell the reason why;
Never to hold her Tongue a Minute,
While all she prats has nothing in it.
Whole hours can with a Coxcomb sit
And take his Nonsense all for wit;
Her Learning mounts to read a song,
But, half the words pronouncing wrong.
Has ev'ry Repartee in Store
She Spoke ten thousand times before.
Can ready Compliments Supply
On all occasions, Cut and dry.
Such hatred to a Parson's Gown,
The Sight will put her in a Soown.
For Conversation well endw'd
She calls it witty to be rude;
And plcing rail'ry in Railing
Will tell aloud your greatest failing.
Nor make a Scruple to expose
Your bandy leg, or crooked nose;
Can, at her morning Tea, run o'er
The Scandal of the day before.
Improving hourly in her skill
To Cheat & wrangle at Quadrill.In chusing Lace a Critick nice
Knows to a Groat the lowest price;
Can in her female Clubs dispute
What lyning best the Silk will suit;
What collours each Complexion match,
And where, with art, to place a patch.If chance a Mouse creeps in her Sight,
Can finly counterfit a fright;
So Sweetly screams if it come near her,
She ravishes all hearts to hear her.
Can dextrously her Husband tize,
By taking fitts when e're she please,
By frequent practice learns the trick,
At propper Seasons to be Sick
Thinks nothing gives one airs so pretty
At once creating Love & Pity.
If Molly happens to be careless
And but neglects to warm her hair lace,
She gets a Cold as sure as death
And vows she scarce can fetch her breath
Admires how modest women can
Be so robustious, like a Man:In party, furious to her pow'r;
A bitter Whig, or Tory Sowr;
Her Arguments directly tend
Against the Side she would defend:
Will prove her Self a Torry plain
From principles the Whigs mantain
And to defend the Whiggish Cause
Her Topicks from the Torries draws.O yes, If any man can find
More vertu's in a womans mind
Let them be sent to Mrs 1a printer in DublinHarding
She'l pay the Charges to a farthing:
Take Notice, She has my Commission
To add them in the next Edition
They may outsell a better thing;
So holla boys, God Save the King.415-187F
